ResourceHeader.ResourceName: STEREO-A IMPACT SWEA Level-2 Burst electron pitch-angle distributions in phase space density
ResourceHeader.Description:
This data set contains the  electron pitch angle distributions (from 0° to 180°) as a function of energy at the BURST cadence (2 s).
The pitch-angles are calculated in the plasma frame based on ion velocity from the PLASTIC instrument (if data is available, according to a flag given in the dataset).
The data is provided in units of phase space density. The reference frame is related to the instrument frame.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement:
Data provided are publicly available. If used in presentations or publications, please acknowledge STEREO/Waves Investigation (M. Maksimovic and S. D. Bale, PIs).
We recommend the data users to contact the STEREO/Waves team early in their study. For reporting purposes, we request bibliography information for any publication, etc., using these data. Please send information on the use of this data to: M. Maksimovic (PI).
We suggest to add the following lines into the acknowledgments:
The authors acknowledge CNES (Centre National d'Etudes Spatiales), CNRS (Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique), and Observatoire de Paris for support to the STEREO/Waves team and the CDPP (Centre de Données de la Physique des Plasmas) for the provision of the STEREO/Waves data.
The following paper should also be used to reference:
- Bougeret et al, Space Science Reviews, 2008, doi:10.1007/s11214-007-9298-8
- Krupar et al., Journal of Geophysical Research, 2012, doi:10.1029/2011JA017333

AccessURL.Name: REGARDS
AccessURL.Description: Access via CNES Data Archive for CDPP

Parameter.Name: STEREO-A SWEA electron pitch angle distributions quality_index_0
Parameter.Description:
quality_index_0 = 0 --> B field INSIDE instrument field-of-view: ALL PA covered.
quality_index_0 = 1 --> B field OUTSIDE instrument field-of-view: NOT ALL PA covered.

Parameter.Name: STEREO-A SWEA electron pitch angle distributions  quality_index_1
Parameter.Description:
quality_index_1 = 0 --> PA distributions corrected for ion bulk flow (from STEREO/PLASTIC) 
quality_index_1 = 1 --> PA distributions NOT corrected for ion bulk flow (Data unavailable)
